Non-refoulement claimants (or asylum seekers) has become a salient issue in Hong Kong's public debate since early 2016 after a senior official from the Immigration Department claimed that the city's screening mechanism of asylum seekers was being abused. When Hong Kong embroiled into one of its largest conflict between pro-democracy protesters and the HKSAR Government in 2019, how might the portrayal of asylum seekers by media outlets affiliated with different political camps be? This thesis aims to investigate this question by using topic modelling from Natural Language Processing to discover the topics of news articles reporting on asylum seekers in 2019 by printed news media.
